articles.headline: Ruben Amorim is set to operate on a more modest budget to former Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag, and will be tasked with maximising the untapped potential in the squad.
articles.article_text:
Ruben Amorim is set to operate on a more modest budget to Erik ten Hag at [Manchester United](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/manchester-united-fc/) and will be tasked with maximising the untapped potential in the squad as the club aim to end the damaging and costly cycle of mass overhauls.

The new United hierarchy have no plans under Amorim to rip up a squad they feel is capable of delivering far more and are determined to move away from a culture of persistent upheaval they believe to be financially unsustainable and destructive to coherent squad building.

Denmark striker Rasmus Hojlund and England midfielder Mason Mount are cited as just two examples of players United are hoping can thrive in a new environment under the charismatic Portuguese, who will take charge of his first game as [the club’s new head coach](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/15/ruben-amorim-manchester-united-players-stadium-tour/) away to Ipswich Town on Sunday. Amorim took official charge of his first training session with United on Monday.

United have averaged five new signings every summer for the past 10 years under four different managers with vastly different ideas of how they want to play. All have had little success to show for the huge expenditure.

While Amorim is expected to be operating under a more modest transfer budget next summer than his predecessor Ten Hag did during his 2½-year reign, when he spent more than £600 million, United want to implement a more sustainable structure where waste is limited, the churn of players greatly reduced and more talent realised.

United hope Amorim can inject new lease of life
-----------------------------------------------

United feel there are plenty of players in the squad who, with better coaching, attention and support in the right system and set-up, have a much higher ceiling than they may have shown previously, and the club [hope Amorim can unlock that potential](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/06/ruben-amorim-manchester-united-five-tactical-masterstrokes/).

Equally, there is a feeling there may be more experienced players who also stand to benefit considerably from Amorim’s arrival and others who find they are given a new lease of life in potentially reimagined roles.

With losses before tax totalling £312.9 million over the past three seasons, United are under huge pressure to reduce costs to ensure continued compliance with the Premier League’s profitability and sustainability rules and Uefa’s own financial sustainability regulations.

Those pressures will become more acute if the club miss out on Champions League qualification for a second successive season and, with it, the vast broadcast revenues that come with playing in Europe’s premier club competition. In that scenario, United would also face a financial penalty under the terms of their kit deal with Adidas.

United, who shed 250 staff jobs in the summer, are continuing to review costs across all areas of the club as they strive to reduce those losses. That includes the possibility of cutting in half the cash they give to the Manchester United Disabled Supporters’ Association, although there is no certainty at this stage that will happen.

The wider financial challenges will ensure a pressing need for United to sell well to raise money to reinvest next year and a sensible approach to buying after years of transfer-market failures and scattergun spending that have left little room for manoeuvre. Old Trafford sources insist it is imperative the club move away from the wasteful, inefficient transfer approach of the past and the cumulative damage of repeat mistakes by building a more sustainable model and structure.

United are unlikely to be particularly active in the January transfer window unless an opportunity presents itself, players leave or injuries or other factors create a problem that has to be addressed.

Amorim given time to assess his squad
-------------------------------------

But Dan Ashworth, the sporting director, Jason Wilcox, the technical director and Omar Berrada, the chief executive, will give Amorim time to assess the squad and see how players adapt to his approach and methods before they start to make any definitive plans for next summer’s window and the type of players and areas they might want to target to supplement what is already there – in addition to who may go.

Christian Eriksen, Victor Lindelof and Jonny Evans are all out of contract next summer, as are Harry Maguire and Amad Diallo, although the club have options to extend both of those players’s deals by another 12 months.

Casemiro and Tyrell Malacia enter the final 12 months of their contracts at the end of the season but with options for another year. Chelsea have an obligation to buy England winger Jadon Sancho, [who is currently on loan at Stamford Bridge](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/08/30/transfer-deadline-day-live-man-u-arsenal-liverpool-chelsea/), next summer so long as the west-London club finish in the top 14 of the Premier League this season.

Amorim takes over a United side who are 13th in the Premier League, albeit just four points off the top four, after the club’s poor start to the season under Ten Hag.

Ruud van Nistelrooy, the Dutchman’s interim replacement, who has since left the club, helped to stabilise results during a four-game spell in charge, which included a 1-1 draw against Chelsea and 3-0 win over Leicester City in the league.

Amorim spoke on Friday about playing “without fear” from day one and “winning time” and patience through victories and establishing a clear identity and idea that the fans can recognise and get behind.

The 39-year-old is expected to implement a change of system by adopting a 3-4-2-1 or 3-4-3 formation, systems that brought him considerable success at Sporting.

Several players whom Ten Hag was unable to call on this season are moving closer to first-team returns, including summer signing Leny Yoro and left-backs Luke Shaw and Malacia, while Amorim will soon hope to have the likes of Kobbie Mainoo and Maguire back after muscle injuries. There are fitness concerns, though, over Lisandro Martinez, who had to withdraw from the Argentina squad last week.

Osimhen è una delle chiavi del mercato di gennaio del Napoli. Tutti vogliono Osi, ma a prezzo ragionevole: come il Manchester United che mette sul piatto il clamoroso scambio con Joshua Zirkzee, rivelazione dell'ultima serie A con il Bologna ma in Premier considerato un bidone. Un'operazione da imbandire nelle prossime settimana. Il Napoli ha delle perplessità: vuole solo cash, non vuole scambi. Ma questo novembre pieno zeppo di gol ha rilanciato i sogni del nigeriano. Dunque, la svolta Osimhen potrebbe già esserci nella sessione invernale: non la plusvalenza sognata ma in ogni caso una cifra niente male. Ma con Osimhen, prima di dare un affare come concluso bisogna aspettare. Anche perché l'ingaggio da 12 milioni netti pesa (e non poco) sulle trattative. Lo scrive Il Mattino.

Ruben Amorim takes decision with Leny Yoro at Manchester United - Manchester Evening News
===============

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Ruben Amorim takes decision with Leny Yoro at Manchester United
===============================================================

Leny Yoro is fully fit and gearing up for his Man United debut under new head coach Ruben Amorim this month.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

*   08:45, 21 NOV 2024
*   Updated08:49, 21 NOV 2024

Yoro in training at Carrington this week

Leny Yoro was withdrawn from the Manchester United Under 21 squad against [Altrincham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/altrincham) on Tuesday night.

Yoro, who is now involved in team training after recovering from a metatarsal fracture, was informed on Monday he was due to start at Altrincham in the 4-0 National [League Cup](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/football-league-cup) victory. He was removed from the squad after training under new head coach Ruben Amorim.

Amorim presided over his first training session at Carrington on Monday and centre back Yoro started on the right of United’s back three, with Jonny Evans in the middle and Luke Shaw on the left.

Yoro is expected to have a key role in Amorim’s new set-up as United transition to a 3-4-3 formation and the 19-year-old could make his debut away at Ipswich Town on Sunday.

The former Lille defender was United’s costliest summer signing in a deal rising to £58.91million but Yoro fractured the metatarsal bone in his left foot during his second start in the pre-season friendly with Arsenal in Los Angeles on July 26.

United could be without centre halves Harry Maguire and Lisandro Martinez at Portman Road. Maguire has been sidelined for seven weeks with a calf injury he sustained in the first half of the goalless draw with Aston Villa on October 6 and he was not involved in the team training session filmed on Monday.

Martinez withdrew from the Argentina squad with a back injury, having received medical treatment from United physio Jordan Reece during their last fixture against Leicester City.

United full back Tyrell Malacia made his first appearance for the club since May 2023 for the Under 21s in their EFL Trophy defeat at Huddersfield Town last week. Malacia has been participating in team training for upwards of a month now.

Shaw, who last played for United on February 18, is back in full training and has excelled at centre half in a duo and a trio.

Sporting expect Manchester United to make an offer for winger Geovany Quenda next year.

Quenda, 17, only made his Sporting debut in August and he was named in the Portugal squad for their Nations League draw with Croatia this week. The _Manchester Evening News_ revealed two weeks ago [United are tracking Quenda](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/manchester-united-tracking-sporting-winger-30311097) but they are yet to submit a formal bid. Sources say United have been following Quenda's progress since the start of the season and he is under contract at Sporting until 2027.

The left-footed Quenda played on the right wing under new United head coach Ruben Amorim at Sporting. He assisted Viktor Gyokeres for his equaliser in the Portuguese champions’ 4-1 thrashing of [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) in the [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league) earlier this month.

Born in Guinea-Bissau, Quenda has only made 18 appearances for Sporting and Portuguese sources have likened his talent and work ethic to Arsenal winger Bukayo Saka. Quenda, previously in Benfica's academy until he switched to Sporting's at the age of 12, was named in the club's matchday squad by Amorim as a 16-year-old last year. He became the club's youngest league scorer against Famalicão last month, beating Cristiano Ronaldo's record, and is Sporting's youngest player to start in the [Champions League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/uefa-champions-league).

Amorim will transfer his 3-4-3 formation to United, who could have issues with incorporating their wide players into the system. Wingers Alejandro Garnacho and Marcus Rashford prefer to operate higher up the pitch and were accused of not tracking back by former United captain [Gary Neville](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/gary-neville) after the recent draw with [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc).

United have not been able to play a senior left back for the majority of the calendar year as Tyrell Malacia last appeared for the club in May 2023 and Luke Shaw has not played for United on February 18. Both are now back in full training.

Full backs Diogo Dalot and Noussair Mazraoui can operate on either side but both are accustomed to operating in a back four. Left-footed right winger Amad is a potential option for Amorim, who must also decide if £85million flop Antony is in his plans.

United famously signed Ronaldo from Sporting in 2003. The club also recruited Nani, Marcos Rojo and Bruno Fernandes from the Portuguese side.

articles.headline: Manchester United make Sekou Kone plan after midfielder's injury scare
articles.article_text:
Manchester United make Sekou Kone plan after midfielder's injury scare - Manchester Evening News
===============

Man United signed Malian Sekou Kone in the summer and the midfielder has an exciting future at Old Trafford.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sekou Kone's injury is not serious and he could return to a pitch in a matter of weeks for Manchester United.

Kone made his first start for the academy in the Under-21s' game against Huddersfield Town in the EFL Trophy last week but limped off the pitch with an injury after 40 minutes. The 18-year-old was hurt after a strong Huddersfield challenge and was subsequently pictured leaving the stadium using crutches and wearing a protective boot on his right foot.

That prompted fears among fans that Kone might have sustained a serious problem, but his injury is not thought to be a major issue and he is expected to return in a matter of weeks, not months, although the club will continue to handle him carefully as he settles in Manchester.

Sources have reiterated patience will be key with Kone. The youngster demonstrated his quality against Huddersfield but there were also clear signs of greenness in his performance.

United will give the 18-year-old time to adapt to his new surroundings and won't rush him. Kone signed from Malian club Guidars FC for around £1million in the summer and the intensity and demands of elite football in England are completely different to what he's been accustomed to in his career.

Kone's dynamic range of passing was on show against Huddersfield but his influence was reduced as the half progressed, with the youngster struggling physically against senior players. United have given Kone the opportunity to train with the first-team at Carrington but he has spent the majority of his time around the U21 group and needs to physically develop.

Kone was first scouted by United in November at the Under-17 World Cup in Indonesia. Multiple staff members from United watched him throughout that tournament as Mali beat Argentina to claim a third-place finish, and they identified a player of significant interest to follow.

Another United scout then attended an Under-18 tournament in Morocco in April where Kone was one of the players of the tournament. It's understood the recommendation to sign Kone came after this tournament and there was communication between the club's scouting team in order to make the deal happen.

“I will definitely not sign for another club on January 1 or 2. I don’t need a quick decision. I have a sympathy for the Premier League, I still watch certain games on TV.

"The attraction for me lies in the club where I can show my best performance, develop and win titles. I have that at Bayern. This is where I have my greatest challenge and goals.”

Reigning world darts champion Luke Humphries has teased a special The Overlap episode. At the time, Neville, Scott and Wright then chose a nickname for Keane, who has been known for his downbeat and blunt nature. "Roy 'the Killer' Keane," Neville suggested. "Roy 'the Grumbler' Keane," Wright added.

articles.headline: Agent explains why it was 'impossible' for Manchester United winger Antony to join Liverpool FC
articles.article_text:
Antony's agent, Junior Pedroso, has said there is truth behind reports claiming Liverpool had interest in signing the Manchester United winger in 2022.

In a report issued by The Times on Tuesday, it was claimed Liverpool had interest in signing the Brazilian as they waited for Mohamed Salah to make a decision on his future.

Salah signed a new contract at Anfield in July 2022, committing his future to the club until June 2025, meaning the Merseysiders' interest in Antony went no further.

The winger did seal an exit from Ajax later that summer, joining United in a deal worth more than £80million. He has struggled to live up to expectations at Old Trafford thus far, scoring 12 goals in 87 appearances.

Amid recent speculation, Pedroso has now confirmed Liverpool were considering a move for Antony prior to Salah putting pen to paper on a new deal ahead of the 2022/23 season.

Speaking to winwin.com, Pedroso said: "Yes, this story has a basis in truth. No, Salah renewed his contract at the time with Liverpool, and that made Antony's move to Liverpool impossible."

Antony was hand-picked by former United manager Erik ten Hag in the summer of 2022 having previously worked with him at Ajax. United had strengthened their right-wing options the previous summer, signing Jadon Sancho, but he had failed to deliver the goods in his first season at Old Trafford.

However, despite scoring on his United debut against Arsenal, Antony is in danger of going down as one of the Premier League's biggest ever flops. He has scored just five goals in 56 league games for the Reds.

He has featured in just two of their opening 11 league matches this season, with his only start across all competitions coming in the 7-0 win over Barnsley in the Carabao Cup third round. He netted a first half penalty that evening.

Manchester United promote another exciting 16-year-old to first-team training - Manchester Evening News
Ruben Amorim coached his first Man Utd training session on Monday and several youngsters were involved.

Manchester United youngster Jim Thwaites took part in first-team training on Monday, despite being aged just 16 years old.

The midfielder predominantly played for the U16s last season, but he made nine appearances for the U18s and was given two substitute appearances for the Under-21s.

He was expected to be given a prominent role in Adam Lawrence's U18 side this season and he's gone from strength to strength, making an appearance in every U18 league game.

Different sources have suggested Thwaites has slightly gone under the radar in the conversation about emerging prospects and the youngster has been tipped to have a bright future.

articles.headline: Viktor Gyokeres to Man United transfer latest amid Ruben Amorim 'agreement' and Sporting dilemma
articles.article_text:
One of the names to be heavily linked is Sporting striker Viktor Gyokeres. The 26-year-old is making waves across Europe with his goalscoring record.

In 18 domestic games across all competitions so far this season, he has scored 23 goals, including a hat trick in the Champions League win over Man City. The striker has also impressed on the international stage for Sweden, scoring nine goals in six Nations League appearances.

Amorim’s move from sporting to United has led to speculation that he could be eyeing a reunion with his former striker. With that in mind, here is the latest on a potential move for Gyokeres, either in January or in the summer.

#### ‘Gentleman’s agreement’

Any potential move for Gyokeres in January could be put on hold, due to a reported ‘gentleman’s agreement’ between Amorim and former club Sporting CP. It is said that the manager has agreed not to approach any of Sporting’s players in the upcoming transfer window.

[Journalist Fabrizio Romano claims](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-man-united-transfer-30418333) that as part of the negotiations that saw Amorim leave the club for United, the agreement was reached. That’s due to Sporting’s hopes of winning their respective title this season, although any summer move for players, including Gyokeres has not been ruled out.

#### What the player has said

Gyokeres himself responded to rumours over his future earlier this week. He gave his thoughts on Amorim’s move to United, before commenting on the links.

"It’s very sad that he’s leaving, but of course we understand his decision," [he said](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/viktor-gyokeres-breaks-silence-man-30387160). "He has of course meant a lot [to me] considering that he gave me that chance and that he made me develop so much."

Gyokeres then added: "He [Amorim] probably has some strikers there already, so we’ll see. No, he hasn’t [contacted me]. It's fun but nothing I attach any importance to because it’s talk and nothing concrete."

#### Sporting ‘need to sell’

Former Portuguese international Jose Fonte has provided hope to United over completing a deal, by highlighting the financial disparity between the two clubs. "We need to sell. Portuguese clubs have to sell one or two players every season.

"We don't have the same TV rights as the Premier League so we don't have the capacity to hold on to players. It would be lovely to see Portugal with a little bit more capacity to hold on to their talent, of course."

#### United monitoring the striker

United Scouts were [reportedly in attendance](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-united-sent-scout-watch-30399381) to watch Gyokeres in Sweden’s 2-1 victory over Sloviakia at the weekend. The striker, of course, was on the scoresheet, finding the back of the net after just three minutes to give his side the lead.

Scouts would have also been impressed with his performance in Sweden’s next game. The striker scored four times in his nation’s 6-0 win over Azerbaijan on Tuesday night.

articles.article_text:
Sporting Lisbon and Sweden striker Viktor Gyokeres is being heavily linked with a move to Man United.
Sporting Lisbon assistant boss Tiago Teixeira has insisted star striker Viktor Gyokeres is 'very happy' in the Portuguese capital amid reports linking him with a move to Manchester United.
The 26-year-old is currently the most sought after striker in Europe after making an explosive start to the season for club and country. His four-goal haul for Sweden against Azerbaijan in the UEFA Nations League on Tuesday night increased his tally of goals this season to 32.
Gyokeres joined Sporting from Coventry City in July 2023 and instantly blossomed under now-United head coach Ruben Amorim. He scored 66 goals in 68 matches under the 39-year-old's stewardship.
Ever since Amorim swapped Lisbon for Manchester earlier this month, reports connecting Gyokeres with a reunion with his former boss have soared. Many believe United would benefit from signing a striker of the Swede's profile. However, Teixeira, who is tasked with supporting Amorim's successor at Sporting, Joao Pereira, is adamant Gyokeres is not in any hurry to leave the Portuguese club.
Teixeira, speaking to the Portuguese media, said: "We are prepared to welcome him today to train for the first time [since being away on international duty] and we are very happy to have him here.
"He is also very happy with the season he is having representing Sporting and his national team. He is very happy to be here. What we want is to have him for as long as possible."
Gyokeres, who joined Sporting for a fee of around £20million, has already played down reports linking him with a move to Old Trafford. He said: "These are rumours, nothing concrete. Of course, I want to finish the season at Sporting. I enjoy my time there. I don't feel stressed about making a change in the future. We'll see when the time comes.
"He [Amorim] probably already has strikers there. It's very sad that he left [Sporting], but of course, we understand the decision. He meant a lot to me, as he gave me an opportunity and helped me evolve a lot."

articles.headline: Angel Gomes Man United return boost as Ruben Amorim transfer stance revealed
articles.article_text:
Former Manchester United midfielder Angel Gomes could return to the club (Image: Eddie Keogh - The FA/The FA via Getty Images) The prospect of Angel Gomes returning to Manchester United is turning heads, especially with it now suggested which way Ruben Amorim leans on the subject.

Gomes was meant to be one of Old Trafford's stars of tomorrow. Raised in Salford, godson to Nani, all seemed to be falling into place when he broke into the first-team under Jose Mourinho but only 10 senior appearances afforded over the three years to follow left Man United on the back foot when the time came to renegotiate terms.

He would move for free to Ligue 1 outfit Lille, with whom he has 129 appearances for over the past four years. Recently rewarded with his first four England caps and again out of contract there come the current season's end, excitement over a possible homecoming has been growing based on recent rumours.

Most crucially, The Sun have claimed that Gomes is a player who has been on Amorim's radar for a 'long time'. The boss is believed to feel the 24-year-old can return to Old Trafford for free next summer and become an integral part of his system. This aligns with the views of both sporting director Dan Ashworth and technical director Jason Wilcox, so the midfielder very much remains a 'major target'.

They are well aware that once January arrives they can get to work on a pre-contract agreement, so seem primed and ready to move, this latest report suggests.

However, it is mentioned that both Arsenal and Tottenham could provide competition.

Speaking in October, the man in question personally admitted 'it'd be difficult to say no' were Man United to make an approach to re-sign him. "I do sometimes think about where I would be now [if I'd stayed at United]," he discussed, though added: "It's normal to feel like that, but the jump and trajectory that I took, the places that I've been, what I've learnt from the different coaches along the way, the detail, effort and love they have put into my game, I don't think I would be where I am now [a full England international] without it.

Of course it cannot be ignored that at least until next July, Gomes is contracted to play for another club. However, the latest word from France suggests they have done little that would prevent Man United from reclaiming their former talent, if they desired to do so. According to L'Equipe, the Englishman seems to be 'edging closer' to the exit door as there have actually been no solid movements from Lille renew terms - not even before he is allowed to talk to potential foreign suitors from New Years' Day.

As amazing as it would be, after finding happiness abroad I know [playing in the Premier League] is not the be-all and end-all. There'll always be that sentimental soft spot, so of course it'd be difficult to say no.

articles.headline: Jamie Carragher says what Ruben Amorim did in first week at Man United should excite supporters
articles.article_text:
Jamie Carragher says what Ruben Amorim did in first week at Man United should excite supporters - Manchester Evening News
===============

Carragher has been impressed by one characteristic Amorim showed during his first few days as Manchester United head coach.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Jamie Carragher says the confidence Ruben Amorim has shown in his own ability should breed confidence among Manchester United supporters.

The 39-year-old gave his first interview as the club’s new head boss last week, just days after arriving at Carrington. He underlined his eagerness to instil a sense of identity back into United and the importance of building momentum from the off.

He makes his debut at Ipswich Town on Sunday with United languishing in 13th. Amorim is expected to field his 3-4-3 formation that brought him two Portuguese titles at Sporting CP.

While former Liverpool star Jamie Carragher does “not think this squad is suited to three at the back”, he believes Amorim’s self-assurance will go a long way. "I’ve been really impressed with what the manager has said so far,” he told The Overlap US.

“He certainly has charisma, a personality, he’s laughing and joking with questions. He got asked the question, ‘If I’m a Manchester United fan, what can I see on day one?’

“And more often than not a manager would bat that question away and say, ‘Oh, hang on, I’ve only had two training sessions, we’ve got a long way to go, there’s a lot to change’.

“But he’s just said straightaway, ‘I can guarantee you that you will see a plan, you’ll see an idea in the first two or three games'.

“I’m not a Manchester United fan, obviously, but if I’m a Manchester United fan that would fill me with confidence that he was so confident in his abilities, his system.”

Carragher warned that Amorim faces heftier competition from lower-table teams in the Premier League than he did in Portugal. But he reckons that United will be put in good stead if Amorim is able to get his squad to buy in and then successfully implement his philosophy.

“Let’s not forget, the Premier League has the best managers in the world and he’s coming up against some top operators, not even necessarily at the top end of the table,” Carragher added.

“You look at people like Marco Silva or Thomas Frank, managers of teams in the middle of the table. They’re top managers.

“I admired how confident [Amorim] was and this real belief he seems to have and if he can put that into Manchester United, because there’s still quality players there, and also make them believe in this system and how they go about it, I think he can do well.”

articles.headline: Ruben Amorim could sell five Manchester United players to fund January transfer window
articles.article_text:
Ruben Amorim could sell five Manchester United players to fund January transfer window - Amie Wilson - Manchester Evening News

The latest Manchester United news and opinion as the new head coach could potentially boost his January transfer budget with sales in his first transfer window with the club.

Antony is one of the players who could potentially be sold by Manchester United in the January transfer window. (Image: Robbie Jay Barratt - AMA/Getty Images)

Ruben Amorim doesn’t have long to get his feet under the table at Manchester United before the chaos of a transfer window is upon us.

The new head coach started working with his players on the training pitch this week as preparations for the weekend’s clash against Ipswich start. The time in training will give Amorim a chance to assess his squad, with decisions to be made ahead of the transfer window that opens in less than two months.

According to the Telegraph, worries over Profitability and Sustainability rules (PSRs), as well as the club wanting to implement a more sustainable structure, means that the transfer budget in January is to be ‘modest.’

However, one way of boosting the budget will be to sell players. With that in mind, here is a look at five players who United could cash in on in the winter window.

1. **Harry Maguire** - The defender arrived for £80 million in the summer of 2019 but has found himself down the pecking order for the last couple of seasons. Maguire has been linked with a move away from Old Trafford over the last few transfer windows, and he will be entering the final six months of his contract when the January transfer window opens.

2. **Victor Lindelof** - Lindelof is in a similar situation to Maguire and is also down the pecking order.

3. **Christian Eriksen** - Another player who will have just six months remaining on his deal in January.

4. **Marcus Rashford** - Rashford has struggled for form this season, and is one player who could bring in decent money.

5. **Antony** - The winger has struggled to make an impact since his £82 million move from Ajax in the summer of 2022, and it is reported that United have already made the decision to cash in when the January window opens.

This winter window presents an opportunity for the club to capitalize on these players to fund new acquisitions for the team.

articles.headline: Pep Guardiola has already said what he'll do if Man City are found guilty of 115 charges as new contract is confirmed

Having joined the Manchester club in in July 2016, [Guardiola's](https://www.sportbible.com/pep-guardiola) new deal will keep him at the Etihad for more than a decade.

And amid the announcement of his extension, the City boss's comments about what he will do if the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) champions are found guilty in the [hearing for their 115 charges have resurfaced.](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-city/man-city-115-charges-andy-goldstein-talksport-415052-20241121)

In February last year, City were charged with breaking the Premier League's [financial fair play rules over a nine-year period between 2009 and until 2018.](https://www.sportbible.com/football/man-city-premier-league-661768-20230206)

And speaking after the details of the charges emerged, Guardiola confirmed that he would stay with the club even if City were found guilty and relegated to a lower division.

Speaking in August, Guardiola said: "At the moment we are innocent until it is proved we are guilty I know the people want it. I know, I feel it. I will wait. Wait and see it and after the sentence has been done we will come here and explain it.

"But absolutely I will not consider my future (if) it depends being here or being in League One. Absolutely. There is more chance to stay if we are in League One than if we were in the Champions League."

Therefore, while City fans will undoubtedly be happy by the news that the six-time Premier League winner was staying at the club, it does not provide any further insight into the potential result of the ongoing hearing into the FFP charges.

Pep Guardiola has won a total of 18 trophies with Manchester City. (Image: Getty)

In the club statement announcing the extension, Guardiola said: “Manchester City means so much to me.

“This is my ninth season here; we have experienced so many amazing times together. I have a really special feeling for this football club.

“That is why I am so happy to be staying for another two more seasons.

“Thank you to everyone for continuing to trust and support me, it has always been an honour, a pleasure and a privilege to be here.

“Hopefully now we can add more trophies to the ones we have already won. That will be my focus.”

Featured Image Credit: Sky Sports/ Manchester City

articles.headline: Fabrizio Romano reveals Ruben Amorim’s top transfer priority ahead of January window with two targets named
articles.article_text:
**Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim has already outlined his plans ahead of the January transfer window, with a left back being the so-called 'priority' position.**

Amorim took charge of his first training session at Carrington on Monday ahead of this weekend's much-anticipated [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) clash against Ipswich Town.

The 39-year-old, who has penned a two-and-a-half year contract at Old Trafford, got to work on implementing his methods as 10 senior first-team players, including [Kobbie Mainoo](https://www.sportbible.com/kobbie-mainoo) and Mason Mount, got the chance to impress.

After footage emerged online, we noticed [a handful of details in the training session](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-training-session-luke-shaw-kobbie-mainoo-283978-20241119). Antony played as a right wing-back – a far from familiar role – while [Luke Shaw](https://www.sportbible.com/luke-shaw) was pushed inside as a left centre-back.

Amorim wants his wing-backs to push high as he continues to push the much-favoured 3-4-3 formation.

And with that in mind, transfer expert [**Fabrizio Romano**](https://x.com/fabrizioromano/status/1859508798802575382?s=46&t=uxXCWj4CwoDO3TqegCIzVA) has indicated that United want to sign a new left-back for Amorim’s system in 2025.

"The club is already assessing options with more than three candidates in list," he said on [**X**](https://x.com/FabrizioRomano/status/1859508798802575382), formerly Twitter. "It only remains to be seen whether it’s gonna happen in January or summer window (most likely)."

Romano has already spoken about Amorim's plans ahead of his first game in charge.

“Left back is a priority position," he said on his YouTube channel. "In 2025, Man Utd want to sign an important left-back. Amorim wants a top left-footed player in that position. Let me say clearly today that [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) are working on a new, important left-back or left-wing back. For sure United will do something there.”

Romano went on to name Bournemouth\\s Milos Kerkez and [Bayern Munich](https://www.sportbible.com/bayern-munich)'s Alphonso Davies as two players on United's shortlist, but they will have competition from elsewhere, with Liverpool already showing an interest in Kerkez.

Romano added: “They are monitoring Kerkez, even before Amorim. Liverpool are also monitoring him and Richard Hughes, [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) director, knows him so well from his time at Bournemouth. It’s not only Kerkez or Davies, there are also other names they are monitoring."

Image credit: Getty

articles.headline: talkSPORT presenter reveals 'whisper' he's heard about Man City's 115 charges and final verdict
articles.article_text:
**TalkSPORT presenter Andy Goldstein has revealed a 'whisper' he has heard surrounding Manchester City's 115 charges of breaching financial rules.**

City's charges relate largely to [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) rules, although a minority of them relate to [UEFA](https://www.sportbible.com/uefa).

A hearing into the charges is currently being held in private, meaning little information has been released to the public. After beginning in September, it is due to last for 10 weeks.

City 'strenuously' deny all the charges and have said they will robustly defend their position.

Potential punishments for the club if found guilty include heavy fines and even the possibility of relegation from the Premier League, it has been reported. A verdict is not expected to be reached before the end of the 2024/25 season.

Now, talkSPORT presenter Goldstein, who formerly presented [Soccer AM](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/andy-goldstein-soccer-am-tim-lovejoy-sky-sports-465192-20241025) and football coverage for Sky Sports, has revealed a 'whisper' he has heard about the case while live-on-air.

He said: "I've heard a whisper. I've heard they're going to be found not guilty of all of them \[the charges\].

"It's just a whisper, it's unconfirmed. It's some bloke down the pub telling me, that sort of level.

"Listen, it's just a whisper. I was the first person to say Declan Rice is going to Arsenal. There's footage of me saying that from around a year before it happened, from a reliable source."

Co-host Darren Bent did joke that the 'reliable source' was perhaps more reliable than Goldstein's City 'whisper'.

_SPORTbible has contacted the Premier League for comment._

What are the 115 charges against Manchester City?
-------------------------------------------------

Man City players celebrate winning the Premier League in 2014 (Image: Getty)

Below, in full, are the 115 charges levelled against Manchester City by the Premier League and UEFA.

*   **Failure to provide accurate and up-to-date financial information from 2009/10 to and including 2017/18 -** 54 alleged breaches
*   **Failure to co-operate with Premier League investigations from December 2018-present \[February 2023\] -** 35 alleged breaches
*   **Failure to provide accurate financial reports for player and manager compensation from 2009/10 to and including 2017/18 -** 14 alleged breaches
*   **Breaches of Premier League profitability and sustainability regulations from 2015/16 to and including 2017/18 -** Seven alleged breaches
*   **Failure to comply with UEFA's regulations, including UEFA's Club Licensing and Financial Fair Play regulations -** Five alleged breaches

Featured Image Credit: Getty

articles.headline: Man City to offer Erling Haaland astronomical 'mega' contract that's never been seen before in Premier League
articles.article_text:
**Manchester City are ready to offer Erling Haaland a so-called 'mega' deal that would make him the highest paid player in Premier League history.**

The 24-year-old striker, who has scored 105 goals in 114 games for City, including 16 this season, is currently in talks with the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) champions over a new big-money contract worth £500,000 per-week.

That's according to [**The Mirror**](https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/erling-haaland-contract-manchester-city-34124235), who suggest that his 'basic salary' would eclipse the Premier League's second-highest paid player, [Kevin De Bruyne](https://www.sportbible.com/kevin-de-bruyne), who is currently on £400,000 per-week.

Haaland has yet to put pen-to-paper as an 'issue' around his £150 million release clause continues to be a stumbling block, but there has been a positive response to recent negotiations.

Manchester City, meanwhile, are hoping that [Pep Guardiola](https://www.sportbible.com/pep-guardiola)'s decision to sign a one-year contract extension will help get Haaland's reported £100 million deal over the line.

That's according to [**The Sun**](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31842930/man-city-offer-haaland-new-contract/), who suggest a contract extension would see [Haaland](https://www.sportbible.com/erling-haaland) remain at City for four or five more years, meaning he could potentially earn in the region of £100 million without bonuses.

Last week, before Guardiola penned his contract extension, Haaland said: “I hope Pep signs a new contract. He has been important for me in the first two-and-a-half years."

He added: “I hope he stays longer. I like Pep a lot and hope he likes me, too.”

Earlier this month, it was reported that [Real Madrid would be willing to offer €200 million \[£166 million\]](https://www.sportbible.com/football/la-liga/real-madrid/transfer-news-jude-bellingham-kylian-mbappe-121257-20241103) to bring Manchester City's top scorer to the club.

Image credit: Getty

Los Blancos president [Florentino Perez](https://www.sportbible.com/florentino-perez) is believed to have put a plan in place if Rodrygo and Vinicius Junior leave the Spanish giants, with Haaland seen as the 'chosen one', according to Spanish outlet [**Fichajes**](https://www.fichajes.net/noticias/real-madrid-ofrece-200-millones-estrella-20241102.html).

"The possibility of joining Real Madrid, a club with such a rich legacy and boundless ambition, is tempting for any footballer," the report adds.

Thoughts on Haaland's future? Let us know in the comments.

articles.headline: Man Utd 'make contact' with European giants for first January signing as Ruben Amorim stamps his mark
articles.article_text:
**Manchester United have made 'direct contact' with Paris Saint-Germain over a January loan move for one of the most expensive signings in their history.**

It looks like new manager Ruben Amorim will operate on a modest budget compared to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united), who spent more than £600 million during his two-and-a-half year spell at Old Trafford..

Earlier this week, [it was reported that United are 'unlikely to be particularly active' in the January transfer window](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-ruben-amorim-premier-league-transfers-795828-20241118) unless an opportunity presents itself. Instead, [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) has been tasked with 'maximising the untapped potential in the squad'.

But it appears an opportunity has indeed presented itself after [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) made contact with [PSG](https://www.sportbible.com/psg) over a January loan move for Randal Kolo Muani.

Kolo Muani, who joined the [Ligue 1](https://www.sportbible.com/ligue-1) side from Eintracht Frankfurt in September last year for £64.2 million plus £12.2 million in add-ons, has struggled to make an impact at the Parc des Princes.

So far this season, the Frenchman has netted just two goals in 12 appearances for Luis Enrique's side, but it appears he has shown enough for United to make a move.

According to [**Alexis Bernard**](https://le10sport.com/auteur/2) of Le10sport, the Reds only recently expressed their interest in Muani.

The report mentions United 'lacking finances' to make a permanent move, so a loan request has instead been submitted for the second half of the 2024/25 campaign.

It adds: "Discussions will continue until the end of the year and the choice will be up to the player to 'continue fighting' or try the English adventure, with a brand new coach ([Ruben Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim)) who seems to want to trust him."

Kolo Muani has struggled to hit the ground running at PSG. Image credit: Getty

Speaking in a recent interview with Telefoot, Kolo Muani expressed his desire to stay and fight for his place at PSG.

"No, I've never thought about it," Muani said when asked about a potential departure.

"You have to keep the mentality. It's up to me to keep working so that the coach trusts me. That's part of my story. I've always had to work hard, things have never been easy for me. You can't let up. If you let up, it's over, then you'll go under."

Featured Image Credit: Getty Images

articles.headline: Gary Neville criticises Marcus Rashford for 'unprofessional' thing he did during international break but Roy Keane disagrees
articles.article_text:
**Roy Keane disagreed with former Manchester United teammate Gary Neville after he questioned the professionalism of Marcus Rashford and Casemiro over their actions during the international break.**

Earlier this week, [Rashford](https://www.sportbible.com/marcus-rashford) made an eight-hour trip to New York to watch the NBA game between New York Knicks and Brooklyn Nets at Madison Square Garden.

The 27-year-old forward, who has scored four goals in all competitions this season, could be seen courtside with friends before meeting Knicks point guard Jalen Brunson.

Casemiro, meanwhile, enjoyed a family holiday to Disney World. "Awesome few days in Orlando with family and friends, will be back soon!!!" he wrote on [**Instagram**](https://www.instagram.com/p/DCe7GZbo4GX/?hl=en&img_index=1). "Thank you, Orlando."

Their trips to the United States were a big talking point on the latest episode of [**Stick To Football**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P9AzSNDn4So&ab_channel=TheOverlap), brought to you by [**Sky Bet**](https://m.skybet.com/), as [Gary Neville](https://www.sportbible.com/gary-neville) raised eyebrows over what happened.

“The professionalism, looking after your body and making sure you’re best prepared for the next training session is critical to every decision you make during the season," Neville said.

"He \[Marcus Rashford\] has got a mental break, he’s got to get away and has got to rest with friends - then you talk about the choice of venue, how far do you fly, what’s the time difference, is that going to give a jet lag issue, is that going to give a stiffness issue from being on a flight for 12 hours?

“This is on Casemiro more than Rashford but if I’m 30 years old and I’m looking after my body – and he’s won five [Champions Leagues](https://www.sportbible.com/champions-league) and is an unbelievable player, but if he was away with Brazil for 10 days, we would say he would struggle this weekend because he’s been away.

"They \[[Casemiro](https://www.sportbible.com/casemiro) and Marcus Rashford\] have chosen that international break. If you are talking about the minor details in being as professional as you can be and as prepared you can be for a training session on a Monday night, that isn’t the best choice of venue.”

Image credit: Instagram/marcusrashford

[Roy Keane](https://www.sportbible.com/roy-keane), however, defended Rashford and Casemiro over their actions.

He said: “For \[Marcus\] Rashford and all these lads, going to the United States and going on private jets, whatever they are doing – like basketball, that’s the norm for them. We’re sitting there and going, ‘all the way to the States?’ They \[players\] would think the States is no big deal.

"We might consider the long flights and the jet lag, but that is their norm. If they were sitting here, they would say, ‘What are you talking about? This is my life and it’s what I do.'"

Ian Wright also gave his take on whether he would have travelled to the US during an international break.

“If it’s my time off then yes, I’d do it," he said. "Simply, because it’s my time off. If you’re going for three or four days, that jetlag won’t cause you too much of a problem.”

Image credit: Instagram/casemiro

He added: “Casemiro and Marcus Rashford are taking a chance that this \[travelling 12 hours to the United States for four days\] is going to be criticised if they don’t play well - they are accepting what’s to come. It puts you under pressure but then suddenly you can see how quickly it will change.

"If he \[Rashford\] doesn’t do well in his first game, and in the next two or three games he scores - nobody cares.

articles.headline: Premier League star's entourage 'convinced' Man Utd will try and sign him as 'excellent' relationship with Ruben Amorim revealed
articles.article_text:
**Manchester United are said to be 'interested' in a player who has an 'excellent' relationship with newly-appointed manager Ruben Amorim, according to reports in Spain.**

Amorim, who will take charge of his first United game on Sunday against Ipswich Town, will operate on a more modest budget compared to [Erik ten Hag](https://www.sportbible.com/erik-ten-hag), who spent more than £600 million during his two-and-a-half year tenure.

In fact, [United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) are 'unlikely to be particularly active' in the January transfer window unless an opportunity presents itself, according to the [**Telegraph**](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2024/11/18/ruben-amorim-reduced-budget-man-utd-end-transfer-churn/), who claim [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) has been tasked with 'maximising the untapped potential in the squad'.

With that being said, a report from Spanish publication [**AS**](https://as.com/futbol/primera/pedro-porro-en-la-mirilla-n/) has named United, Manchester City and Real Madrid as those competing to sign Spurs right-back Pedro Porro.

Porro played under [Ruben Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) at Sporting Lisbon, where he notched 12 goals and 20 assists in 98 appearances for the Portuguese club.

It is claimed that 'those close' to the defender are 'convinced' that the arrival of Amorim will imply an attempt to sign him.

The report goes on to mention his 'excellent' relationship with the Portuguese coach, who transformed the landscape at Sporting after taking over in 2020, winning two league titles.

Speaking to [**Expresso**](https://tribuna.expresso.pt/entrevistas-tribuna/2024-04-19-entrevista-a-pedro-porro-em-2021-escondi-uma-lesao-para-participar-no-jogo-do-titulo-pelo-sporting.-queria-ir-a-jogo-sim-ou-sim-520395c4) earlier this year, Porro was full of praise for Amorim.

“He is young, has a lot of ambition, a little bit like [Ange Postecoglou](https://www.sportbible.com/ange-postecoglou) here at [Tottenham](https://www.sportbible.com/spurs)," the Spanish full-back said. "He always wants more and that’s what puts him on the world’s lips and coveted by so many teams in Europe,"

Porro added: “He has a special way of working. He plays eye to eye against any opponent, which is also similar to what we do at Tottenham, there are several similarities. It is known and recognised how Sporting and Tottenham play. There is a clear identity, whether winning 5-0 or losing 5-0.”

Pedro Porro was a regular starter under Amorim at Sporting. Image credit: Getty

Porro has gone from strength to strength in recent years. After impressing on loan at Spurs, the North London club snapped him up for around £40 million in January 2023.

Featured Image Credit: Getty Images

Topics: [Ruben Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim), [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league), [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united)

articles.headline: Man Utd could 'hijack' move for Real Madrid's top transfer target in deal that would rock the Premier League
articles.article_text:
**Real Madrid are ‘concerned’ that their pursuit of a Champions League winner could be hijacked by Manchester United.**

[United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) are currently 13th in the Premier League but will be hoping their fortunes improve under new head coach Ruben Amorim.

He will take charge of his game as head coach of the Red Devils when his side faces Ipswich Town at Portman Road on Sunday, 24 November.

As for [Madrid](https://www.sportbible.com/real-madrid), they have started the season in poor form by their high standards, with Los Blancos currently trailing league leaders [Barcelona](https://www.sportbible.com/barcelona) by six points, having sustained an embarrassing 4-0 loss against the Catalans on October 26.

The 15-time European Champions also sit 18th in the 36-team Champions League group phase, having suffered shock defeats against Lille and AC Milan.

Carlo Ancelotti’s options have been ravaged by injuries in recent months, with key players Dani Carvajal and Eder Miltao both sustaining anterior cruciate ligament injuries, which will keep them out for the foreseeable future. David Alaba is also nursing a long-term injury.

Both clubs may look to bolster their squad in upcoming transfer windows with Bayern Munich full-back Alphonso Davies, 24.

The Premier League club have ‘already made informal enquiries’ with Davies possibly open to leaving Bayern ‘as a free agent’ next summer, according to Sky Germany’s [Florian Plettenberg](https://x.com/Plettigoal/status/1849845778698662137).

From Davies’ perspective, having two of the world’s biggest clubs reportedly keen on him is an achievement.

Alphonso Davies is attracting the interest of Real Madrid and Man United (Credit:Getty)

The left-back has played nine Bundesliga games since Vincent Kompany took charge of the Bavarians but could look to move on when his current Bayern contract expires this summer.

If he were to move to United, he would provide competition for first-choice Luke Shaw as well as [Tyrell Malacia](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-tyrell-malacia-premier-league-fa-cup-787613-20241115), who is still returning to fitness after a prolonged period out.

If Madrid was his chosen destination, Davies would be competing for a starting spot against Carlo Ancelotti’s preferred starting left-back, Ferland Mendy, as well as backup option Fran Garcia.

Davies' agent recently issued an update on his client’s situation, according to [Fabrizio Romano.](https://x.com/FabrizioRomano/status/1857503370036081127)

“Done deal with Real Madrid? This is NOT true,” [Nedal Huoseh](https://x.com/FabrizioRomano/status/1857503370036081127) explained on November 15.

“Though the player has many options, we have not agreed terms with any club.

“\[A\] New deal at FC Bayern could also be an option. Any reports suggesting otherwise are incorrect.”

articles.headline: Man Utd players have already come up with a 'nickname' for Ruben Amorim after first training sessions
articles.article_text:
**Manchester United’s players already have a ‘nickname’ for head coach Ruben Amorim.**

[Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-utd-manager-simulation-784663-20241107), 39, arrived at the club’s Carrington Training Centre on Monday and was greeted by several members of the Red Devils’ hierarchy – including sporting director Dan Ashworth, CEO Omar Berrada and technical director Jason Wilcox**.**

On the same day, he took charge of training for the first time, with the Portuguese having just ten senior players available due to the ongoing international break.

As a result, several academy players joined in the session.

Amad, who is thought to be [impressing his new boss](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/manchester-united-ruben-amorim-team-news-249622-20241119), Marcus Rashford and Kobbie Mainoo were among the training squad.

The former Sporting Club boss faces a tough trip to Portman Road on Sunday, 24 November, where he will take charge of his first game as United boss against Ipswich Town.

[Fans have been paying close attention](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/man-utd-ruben-amorim-training-premier-league-105159-20241118) to the footage of training ahead of the fixture as they try to piece together his potential starting line-up.

The [Sun](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31820352/ruben-amorim-man-utd-alex-ferguson-shadow/) Sport reported that the players have been ‘blown away’ by Amorim’s ‘Mourinho-style’ confidence.

“Even before Monday’s first session, the players have been very impressed,” a source explained.

“Then, after the sessions, they are blown away by his energy, approach and confidence.

“There’s definite Mourinho vibes in the way he speaks and his self-belief - but the style is his own.

“The players think he’s very approachable and that he will understand them. Some of them are calling him Mourinho 2.0.”

Ruben Amorim oversaw training this week (Credit:Getty)

Amorim’s ‘confidence’ is backed up by his impressive record in his native Portugal.

The 39-year-old helped Sporting secure their first title in 19 years when he led them to the 2020/21 Primeira Liga crown before adding a second league trophy in 2023/24.

Understandably, many United fans are looking at Amorim as the man who could restore the club to the glory days of the past, the Premier League is a tougher place to thrive than Portugal’s top flight.

Amorim insisted he and his players will need “time” to find success at the club when speaking during his first interview with Manchester United’s official website \[via [MUTV](https://www.manutd.com/en/news/detail/how-to-watch-ruben-amorim-first-interview-with-mutv)\] on November 15.

"We know that we need time, but we have to win time,” Amorim explained.

“To win time is to win games.

“But the most important thing for me is identity.

"So, from day one, we will start with our identity.

“The most important thing for me at this moment is to create the principles, the identity and the character that we had in the past.

articles.headline: Jermaine Jenas' wife Ellie Penfold breaks silence on 'incredibly difficult' sexting scandal and BBC sacking
articles.article_text:
**Jermaine Jenas' wife Ellie Penfold has spoken out after her husband was sacked by the BBC following complaints about workplace conduct.**

An official statement from the BBC confirmed that [Jenas had been taken off presenting duties for both The One Show and Match of the Day](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/v) due to alleged inappropriate behaviour.

Jenas [later admitted to sending 'inappropriate messages' to two of his BBC colleagues](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/jermaine-jenas-bbc-sacked-statement-064908-20240823), though clarified that they were not sexual and that he did 'nothing illegal'.

And now, Jenas' wife has finally broken her silence on the scandal and revealed how it has impacted her and her husband.

On Tuesday, Penfold appeared at the launch of her personal care brand Preppy, a specialist range for children and teens, and spoke about the scandal involving her husband.

According to [The Sun](https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/31818932/jermaine-jenas-wife-ellie-breaks-silence/), Penfold said: “It has been an incredibly hard and difficult time for myself and my family.

“My only focus has been on our children and building my brand Preppy.

“Now I just want to move forward.

“Naturally this has been hard for me but my only concern has been our children and that will not change.”

Despite appearing at the launch without her wedding ring, Penfold added that Jenas was completely supportive of her new businesses and was looking forward to seeing where it could go in the future.

"I have been working on this brand for three years and it is something I am incredibly proud of,” she added.

"Jermaine is excited for the business and what it holds for me in the future.

“He has been supportive of me in this respect and as a working mum.”

Jermaine Jenas and Ellie Penfold got married on 11 June 2011. (Image: Getty)

When details of the scandal became public in August, Jenas spoke with [The Sun](https://www.thesun.co.uk/tvandshowbiz/30060523/jermaine-jenas-ashamed-texting-cheating/) about how it had impacted him and his relationship with his wife Ellie.

He said: “I was in shock at the time, there was a lot to process. But I’m the married one, I’m at fault.

“The overriding panic by a mile was that I could lose my family.

“There’s something in me that’s praying there is some level of mercy or understanding of the fact we’re human beings and we all make mistakes, some bigger than others and mine is a big mistake.”

“Ellie is absolutely raging. She’s human.

“When I see her now, she is just making sure the children are okay.

articles.headline: Liverpool fans convinced Trent Alexander-Arnold is leaving after seeing what's just appeared in Madrid
articles.article_text:
**Liverpool fans have made their mind up about Trent Alexander-Arnold's potential move to Real Madrid after seeing what just appeared in the Spanish capital.**

[Alexander-Arnold](https://www.sportbible.com/trent-alexander-arnold), 26, is out of contract at the end of the season and will be able to start talks with foreign clubs from January 1, 2025.

The [Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) man has played an integral part in the club's early season success under new boss Arne Slot - the Reds currently sit top of the Premier League and 36-team Champions League group phase.

However, arguably the biggest negative surrounding the club is the contractual situation of Alexander-Arnold, [Mohamed Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/football/transfer-news/liverpool-arne-slot-premier-league-889266-20241120), and [Virgil van Dijk](https://www.sportbible.com/virgil-van-dijk) – all three are out of contract at the end of the 2024/25 campaign.

Although there is no doubting the ability of Van Dijk and Salah, the ages – 33 and 32, respectively – of the players could be a sticking point in contract negotiations.

However, with Alexander-Arnold at 26 and arguably approaching his peak, losing him, especially without receiving a transfer fee, would be far from ideal for the Reds.

Although the situation is still unclear, Liverpool supporters were shocked when they came across a giant advert of the player in Madrid, posted to X by [Anfield Wrap](https://x.com/TheAnfieldWrap/status/1859185827655385505).

The Liverpool defender was pictured alongside model and actress Iris Law for a shoot for fashion brand 'Guess' on a billboard, which was emblazoned on the side of a building located at Plaza Felipe II – the place where thousands of Liverpool fans gathered ahead of their 2-0 win over Tottenham in the 2019 Champions League final held in the city.

What do Liverpool fans think?
-----------------------------

Fans were quick to offer their thoughts in the comment section.

One fan said: “If he goes, he goes, \[it\] won't go down well with LFC fans if he walks away for nothing. I’ve seen us lose better players going back to Rush leaving for Juventus.

“We've always kicked on.”

A second added: “It's obvious he's going, what I'm interested in is when he's gonna announce it.

"And what impact it has on our run-in, given that it won't go down well and the Klopp announcement last season derailed us.”

With a third saying: “It's just advertising for a brand that has nothing to do with football... Move on.”

However, the [Liverpool Echo](https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/trent-alexander-arnold-billboard-truth-30411807) explained how the advert was not linked to any potential move to Real Madrid, with the billboard also seen in Italy and the Netherlands previously.

articles.headline: Liverpool 'planning shock move for £50m Premier League star' as swap deal planned
articles.article_text:
**Liverpool are ‘planning’ a move for an in-form Premier League forward – but they may have to compete with a rival to sign the player.**

[Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/football/transfer-news/liverpool-arne-slot-premier-league-la-liga-club-922421-20241119) have started the season in excellent fashion, with new manager Arne Slot seeing his side pick up 15 wins in his first 17 games in charge of the Reds.

The Merseyside-based side also sit top of both the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) and the 36-team [Champions League](https://www.sportbible.com/champions-league) group phase.

However, one of the first challenges faced by Slot when he arrived was the lack of new players coming into the club during the summer transfer window.

Just Federico Chiesa and Giorgi Mamardashvili were recruited, with the Georgian ‘keeper instantly loaned back to Valencia until the end of the 2024/25 campaign.

The Reds tried and failed to sign Real Sociedad ‘number six’ Martin Zubimendi, but so far, [Ryan Gravenberch](https://www.sportbible.com/ryan-gravenberch) has performed well in the role.

Despite most things currently being positive at the club, the only real negatives are the contractual situations [Mohamed Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/jurgen-klopp-liverpool-mohamed-salah-326140-20241119), [Trent Alexander-Arnold](https://www.sportbible.com/trent-alexander-arnold) and [Virgil van Dijk](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/liverpool-virgil-van-dijk-netherlands-998856-20241118) find themselves in – all three are out of contract at the end of the season.

However, the club are now ‘weighing’ up a move for the Egyptian's potential replacement, according to [The Sun](https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/31824263/bryan-mbeumo-transfer-liverpool-newcastle-exclusive/).

Liverpool are thought to be keen on Brentford’s Bryan Mbeumo, 25, who has been in impressive form, having already netted eight goals in 11 appearances for the Bees this term.

Mbeumo is most comfortable playing as a right forward/winger, which happens to be the position Salah takes up in the Liverpool side.

Bryan Mbeumo could be Liverpool's Mo Salah replacement (Credit:Getty)

But Slot’s side may be in for some tough competition to sign the player as Newcastle United have been ‘watching’ the player, who is said to be highly regarded by Magpies’ boss Eddie Howe.

The report suggests the Tynesiders may be willing to offer Callum Wilson as part of a potential £50m deal, but it is still unclear if talks are underway between either of the clubs.

What has Bryan Mbeumo said about a potential transfer?
------------------------------------------------------

Back in May 2024, the France-born Cameroon international admitted he would like to play at the “best clubs”.

“I have spent five years at Brentford, at a club that has allowed me to grow and pass a milestone, but yes, I would like to play in the biggest competitions, at the best clubs," he said in an interview with [L’Equipe](https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Article/Bryan-mbeumo-brentford-pret-a-passer-un-cap-en-angleterre/1471234).

"It is tantalising to see some big clubs interested in me. We will see \[about a transfer\]."

The 25-year-old’s current Brentford contract is set to run until June 2026.

articles.headline: Man Utd manager Ruben Amorim reveals big regret that wife 'throws in his face' every day
articles.article_text:
**Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim has opened up on the regret that his wife "throws in my face every day".**

The 39-year-old, who will take charge of his first United game on Sunday as the Reds come up against Ipswich Town, has enjoyed a remarkable rise since taking over at third-tier Portuguese sider Casa Pia in 2018.

He went on to impress at Braga, the club he spent a year at during his playing career, before [Sporting](https://www.sportbible.com/sporting-lisbon) triggered the €10 million (£8.3m) clause in his contract. The rest, as they say, is history.

But one big regret from his journey came before [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) made his professional debut for Primeira Liga side Belenenses in 2003.

Speaking in an interview with Portuguese newspaper [**Expresso**](https://tribuna.expresso.pt/), Amorim revealed that he still gets teased by his wife, Maria Joao Diogo, for leaving school before taking his exams at the age 18.

In short, Amorim regrets not having a better education after being unable to complete his school exams.

“I had an agreement with my mother. I would continue at school until I signed a professional contract," he said.

"I signed when I was 17. Today, I regret it a lot. If I’d taken my exams, I could have done the 12th year. I could also have entered a top college. My wife is an electrotechnical engineer and she throws that in my face every day.”

Maria, who tied the knot with Amorim at the Palacio de S. Marcos church in Coimbra, holds a degree in telecommunications engineering and now runs her own interior design business.

In fact, she runs the business called Dois Ton with Raquel; the wife of [Manchester City](https://www.sportbible.com/man-city) director of football Hugo Viana.

The Athletic's Charlotte Harpur recently spent a week speaking to Amorim's family and friends to gain an insight into the new [Manchester United](https://www.sportbible.com/man-utd) manager.

"It's his charisma, it's his smile," Harpur told [**talkSPORT**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4XHDavi8KD0)."It's very easy to say, but when you interact with him, just from a media perspective, it's fresh and it is different, especially in contrast to Erik ten Hag.

"I think you can always get a bit carried away. They say it's the hope that kills you, but from the impression that I've had, speaking to his family and to his friends, even in his recent and quite short experience as a coach, they feel he is different and can offer a fresh look. It's hard to express, they said.

"He's going to provide Manchester United, hopefully, with a clean page and a new perspective."

articles.headline: Uruguayan media make their feelings clear on Darwin Nunez as Liverpool striker hauled off at half-time vs Brazil
articles.article_text:
**Media in Uruguay have spoken out about Darwin Nunez after the Liverpool star was taken off early during the international match against Brazil.**

On Tuesday, [Brazil](https://www.sportbible.com/brazil) and [Uruguay](https://www.sportbible.com/uruguay) faced off in a qualifying match for the [2026 World Cup](https://www.sportbible.com/football-world-cup) in Salvador, Brazil.

The match ended as a 1-1 draw with goals from Uruguayan [Real Madrid](https://www.sportbible.com/real-madrid) midfielder [Federico Valverde](https://www.sportbible.com/federico-valverde) and Brazil's Gerson.

[Liverpool](https://www.sportbible.com/liverpool) striker [Nunez](https://www.sportbible.com/darwin-nunez) started the match for the visitors but was taken off over half-time, and now Uruguayan media have revealed exactly why.

After a goalless first half, Uruguay manager [Marcelo Bielsa](https://www.sportbible.com/marcelo-bielsa) decided to replace Nunez with Rodrigo Aguirre as he had been ineffective in the match up until the break.

Uruguayan media later confirmed that the substitution had been a tactical decision and that the 25-year-old had not suffered an injury early in the game.

Local outlet [El Observador](https://www.elobservador.com.uy/seleccion/el-uno-uno-del-primer-tiempo-uruguay-vs-brasil-mathias-olivera-banco-el-fondo-y-facundo-pellistri-animo-el-ataque-n5970992) rated the striker's performance as a five out of ten, praising his defensive working while noting that he did not have a single shot on goal, in part due to a lack of service from his teammates.

Uruguayan newspaper [El Pais](https://www.elpais.com.uy/ovacion/futbol/el-1x1-de-uruguay-contra-brasil-por-eliminatorias-la-lucidez-de-bentancur-y-el-temple-defensivo-de-olivera) also handed Nunez the same rating for his performance in the match, writing: "Good work with his back to the goal.

"Precise in his first touches. He came off after 45 minutes of the first half."

Liverpool fans will be happy to see that their man up front only played half of the match on Tuesday as it remains likely that he will start for their trip to St Mary's Stadium to face Southampton on Sunday.

After traveling to Southampton, Liverpool will face a tough set of fixtures including back to back home matches against has Real Madrid in the Champions League and Manchester City in the Premier League.

Darwin Nunez started both of Uruguay's matches over the international break. (Image: Getty)

With Diogo Jota still recovering from an injury sustained during the match with Chelsea, it is likely that Nunez will start, or at least feature, in all three of Liverpool's next matches.

Speaking before the international break, Arne Slot confirmed when Jota is expected to return, saying: “We expect him back after the break. The first weeks after the break,

“I always say there is privacy about the injury.

“He will be back one or two weeks after the break.”

Featured Image Credit: Getty

articles.headline: Man Utd have player who is 'impossible to ignore' as Ruben Amorim told to take immediate action
articles.article_text:
**Ruben Amorim has been told about a player in the Manchester United ranks who is "impossible to ignore" as he prepares to take charge of his first game.**

After succeeding Erik ten Hag as the next [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) head coach, [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) has some big decisions to make in the coming months when it comes to team selection.

Amad Diallo is set for a 'prominent' role under the new manager, according to journalist [**Dean Jones**](https://www.givemesport.com/author/dean-jones/), who says Amorim is 'excited' by the winger's technical ability, work off the ball, and creativity in the final third.

We will get more of an insight into his thinking on Sunday afternoon, when United travel to Portman Road to take on newly-promoted [Ipswich Town](https://www.sportbible.com/ipswich-town).

But ahead of the [Premier League](https://www.sportbible.com/premier-league) clash, Amorim has been urged to take a look at one of their academy prospects.

Earlier this week, United under-21s maintained their unbeaten record in the National League Cup with a 4-0 win over Altrincham as highly-rated striker Ethan Ennis scored a hat-trick.

And the 19-year-old forward has been tipped to push for a spot in the first-team by Steven Railston of the [**Manchester Evening News**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-uniteds-young-winger-impossible-30408332).

Ennis, who penned a new contract in the summer, will spend the first half of the season with United's under-21s before his situation is assessed in January. He could
